unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Inventory Forecasting Takes Center Stage Ahead of Festive Season**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Inventory Forecasting Takes Center Stage Ahead of Festive Season**

unnormalised: Mumbai, India – With Onam just around the corner, and Diwali following shortly after, Indian manufacturers are increasingly focusing on advanced inventory forecasting techniques to optimize their supply chains and meet the anticipated surge in demand. A recent report by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) highlights a 15% increase in investment towards predictive analytics tools compared to last year.
normalised: Mumbai, India – With Onam just around the corner, and Diwali following shortly after, Indian manufacturers are increasingly focusing on advanced inventory forecasting techniques to optimize their supply chains and meet the anticipated surge in demand. A recent report by the Confederation of Indian Industry (C I I) highlights a fifteen percent increase in investment towards predictive analytics tools compared to last year.

unnormalised: Specifically, companies like Tata Steel and Mahindra & Mahindra are leveraging AI-powered forecasting platforms to accurately predict raw material needs and finished goods demand, minimizing stockouts and reducing storage costs. This proactive approach aims to ensure smooth operations and prevent supply chain disruptions, especially during peak periods like festival-related biryani ingredient rushes and gift-giving seasons.

unnormalised: Professor Sharma from IIT Delhi notes that integrating historical sales data, market trends, and even weather patterns is proving crucial for accurate forecasting. Furthermore, smaller enterprises are exploring cloud-based solutions to make these advanced capabilities more accessible and affordable, leveling the playing field across the Indian manufacturing landscape. The goal? To deliver products efficiently and effectively, satisfying consumers celebrating across the nation.
